III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation 1. A former youth reported that when they were being
restrained at the facility, staff would shove socks in youths’
mouths if they would scream or yell while being restrained.
2. During a restraint staff pulled a youth’s legs out from under
her.
3. During a restraint staff were leaning on the youth’s
stomach/side.
Investigation Allegation 1
A complaint was received on 4/4/23 that alleged staff would put
socks in the youth’s mouth during restraints if they would yell or
scream.
This complaint came in after all youth had moved from the facility
and staff were either transferred to another license or laid off. All
interviews included a DHHS Worker unless otherwise noted.
Interviews
6

Contact was made with the complainant on 4/5/2023 and she did
not have any additional information to share.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at her current
placement on 4/6/23. Courtesy DHHS Worker 1 was also
present. Youth A stated she was previously at Vassar House and
it is a horrible place. Staff sat there and did not do anything. Youth
A was in a restraint on her first day but no other restraints. She
witnessed a restraint with Youth B completed by Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3. Prior to the restraint Youth B and Youth C were trying
to fight. The staff had the other girls leave the unit as Youth B
continued to act out. When the girls returned to the unit Youth B
continued to act out, flipped over furniture and took her shirt off.
Youth A was sitting on her bed when Youth B was restrained near
Youth A's bed. The staff put a shirt over Youth B's head. Staff 6
told the staff restraining Youth B to put a shirt in Youth A's mouth.
Youth A could not recall what day this occurred. Youth B was face
up on the floor with Staff 1 and Staff 2 holding her arms and Staff
3 on the legs. Staff 6 said to put the shirt over Youth B’s head but
Staff 4 corrected him and said the shirt could only be placed in the
mouth. Youth B was restrained multiple times that night, but this
was the only restraint Youth A saw. Youth D, Youth E, Youth F,
Youth G, and Youth H were also present for the restraint. During
the restraint Youth B was spitting and trying to bite. This is why
the staff put the shirt in her mouth. Youth B tried to talk to them
while the shirt was in her mouth. She was telling the staff to take
the shirt out of her mouth. Youth A reported she felt that the staff
at the facility took their anger out on the kids. She never told
anyone staff put socks in the youth’s mouths during restraints.
Youth A reported the Chief Administrator (CA) had met with the
girls and provided them with the rules of restraints saying the staff
could put a shirt in the girls’ mouths if they were spitting or biting
while in a restraint.
Youth B was initially interviewed by Courtesy DHHS Worker 2
who did not include this consultant in the interview on
4/11/23. The courtesy worker provided her notes. Youth B told the
courtesy worker that she did not know Staff 6’s first name but
confirmed it was a male staff who had injured his ACL and at one
point was working at the booth due to this injury.
Youth B was again interviewed this time it was conducted face to
face at her current placement on 4/13/23 by this consultant. An
attempt was made to connect the DHHS Worker by phone, but it
was unsuccessful. Youth B was accompanied by one of the
detention guards. She was asked about her time at the facility.
7

She stated she was "bad" and had a lot of restraints while at the
facility. She was asked if staff ever put a shirt in her mouth or on
her face and she stated the staff did put a shirt on her mouth but
not in it. She could not recall the staff who did this. The entire unit
was present including Youth A. The restraint occurred right in front
of Youth A's bed and Youth A was standing right there. She said
the staff put a T-shirt on her face then she ripped the t-shirt and
they put a mask over her mouth, but she ripped that too. She said
staff did this because she was spitting, and they did not have a
spit shield. The staff usually use a mask when they are spitting
during a restraint, but all the staff were holding her and none of
them could leave to get a mask. It took all the staff to restrain her
because she fought in the restraint. She said the shirt was just
covering her mouth not her entire head. She did not have any
concerns with the restraint.
Youth B did have concerns with a restraint that was completed on
Youth I. The staff holding Youth I were "messing" her up. Youth I
was not supposed to be in a restraint because she had Asthma.
The staff put a shirt over Youth I's mouth making it hard for her to
breath. Staff 6 was holding onto Youth I's legs until a female staff
could switch with him because male staff are not to hold the legs.
Youth C and Youth L were the only other youth in Unit 1 at the
time of the incident with Youth I. Youth B stated Staff 10 placed
the shirt over Youth I’s head. Staff 4 told Staff 10 she could not put
a shirt over Youth I's face. Youth B stated CA never talked to the
girls about staff being allowed to put things in their mouth during
restraints. She said he did have a talk with all the girls about
restraints but that was not something he talked about.
According to the DHHS Worker Youth C refused to be
interviewed for any investigation.
Youth K was interviewed face to face at her current
placement on 4/17/23 along with Courtesy DHHS Worker 1.
Youth K reported that her and Youth I got into a fight. Youth I was
restrained. While Youth I was in the hold the staff pulled her shirt
up over her mouth because she was spitting. Staff 4 was covering
Youth I's mouth with the shirt. Youth I was saying she could not
breath. Youth I was in restraint after restraint that day.
An interview was attempted with Youth F at the home of a
friend on 5/10/23 but she refused to be interviewed.
Youth I was interviewed face to face at her home on 4/18/23
along with Courtesy DHHS Worker 3. She reported she was
8

restrained a couple of times while at the facility. She was
restrained one time by Staff 6 and Staff 10 in a standing hold. She
asked Staff 6 to call Staff 4. Youth I and Staff 6 argued about it.
Youth I threatened to spit on Staff 6, so he called Staff 4 for a spit
mask. Youth I said she was spitting but not on him. Staff 4 could
not find a spit mask. Staff 6 asked Staff 4 if they could cover her
mouth and Staff 4 said he could. Staff 6 pulled Youth I's t-shirt and
sweatshirt up over her entire head. Staff 4 said that the shirts
could only be over Youth I's mouth so Staff 25 pulled Youth I’s
shirt down. Youth I's head was covered in the time it took Staff 4
to walk from the front door to the bathroom. When Staff 4 noticed
what Staff 6 had done she quickly made her way over to them by
the bathroom. Youth I said she could breathe while the shirts were
over her mouth. She reported if there is no spit mask then the staff
can cover their mouth but cannot cover their nose. Youth I said
she was told the staff could do this for their safety. Youth I stated
she did not know who told her but stated it was not CA. Youth I
reported she does not have asthma but does have breathing
problems.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at her school on
4/26/23. Youth D stated she was never restrained while at the
facility. She did, however, witness restraints. One time Youth D
heard Youth B was trying to bite the staff, so the staff put a t-shirt
in Youth B's mouth. Youth D did not see this occur she just heard
staff say to put a t-shirt in Youth B's mouth. She did not know
which staff said this.
Youth H was interviewed face to face at her current
placement on 4/27/23. Youth H reported the staff at the facility
were rude and only there for the money. The restraints were
horrible and not done right. One time Youth B was restrained by
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 8. While in the restraint the staff put a
shirt over Youth B's face. Youth H thought it was Staff 1, but she
was not sure who put the shirt over Youth B's face. Youth H knew
they did this because she could see the shirt on youth B's face.
Youth H thought Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 7, Staff 8, and Staff
22 were present for this restraint with Youth B. Youth H said this
restraint occurred by her personal isle (P isle) that she shared with
Youth A. She said Staff 1 was present for the restraint but
switched out with Staff 8.
Youth H reported she saw staff shove socks in Youth O's mouth
during a restraint because Youth O was spitting. Youth H said
Youth O was naked at the time and tried to drink soap. That is
9

when the staff restrained her. Youth H said this happened in
December. She did not know which staff did this.
Youth O was interviewed face to face at her current
placement by Courtesy DHHS Worker 7 on 5/3/23 (This
consultant participated by phone) and again by video
conferencing on 6/29/23. Youth O said prior to her current
placement she was at the facility from 11/22/22 to 3/8/23. She
reported when she would run the staff would restrain her. She said
the staff would hold her shirt over her nose. She told the staff she
could not breath, but they would not do anything. She said she
would hyperventilate and would spit up. Staff thought she was
spitting at them so they would keep her mouth covered. Youth O
reported this was only done with her and none of the other girls.
The staff never used anything except her shirt to cover her mouth.
She said this happened about 6 times. The last time it happened
was 3/6/23 with Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 13. She said Staff 4
covered her mouth. She did tell them she could not breath. She
stated nothing else besides a shirt was used for this. Nothing was
placed inside her mouth and no sock was used. She said it
happened between 4 and 6pm in the parking lot. The staff would
not use a spit mask on her because she would bite through the
mask.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at her school on 5/19/23
by Courtesy DHHS Worker 6. This consultant participated in the
interview by phone. Youth E stated staff at the facility did
restraints properly. She never saw staff put socks in any of the
girls mouths while they were in restraints. Youth B pulled her own
shirt up over her head and staff would try to get it off due to self-
harm. Then the staff would restrain Youth B. She never saw a
staff put a shirt over a youth's face during a restraint. The staff at
the facility would never do that. All the staff at the facility are
sweet.
Youth L was interviewed face to face at her current placement
on 5/24/23. Youth L stated she was never restrained while at the
facility. She did, however, witness many restraints. She witnessed
a restraint with Youth I that lasted hours because she would not
calm down. Youth I would spit at the staff. They would use a spit
mask when they could but during this incident, they did not have
one so they pulled her shirt collar up over her face. The staff were
not supposed to cover Youth I's entire face but just her mouth.
The new staff put her shirt over her head. The new staff was a guy
who had torn his ACL. Youth I told him he could not cover her
face. Youth L said she was sleeping when the hold ended. She
10

did not see any other restraint in which a shirt was put over a
youth's face. When she did see it with Youth I it was not on her
face very long. Youth I did say she could not breath when her
mouth was covered. Staff 11 came in and told them to remove the
shirt from her face and said it could only be over her mouth. Youth
L did not see anything concerning about Youth B's restraints. She
never saw anything over Youth B's face or placed in the mouth
during restraints.
Youth P was interviewed face to face at her school on 5/31/23.
Youth P saw a restraint with Youth I. Youth I fought Youth K. Staff
11, Staff 2, Staff 19, and Staff 21 were present. Youth I said she
was unsure who else was involved. This took place in unit 4.
Youth I was talking about Youth K. Youth K was on her bed and
looked to be sleeping. Youth I got up out of a chair and Youth K
got up also. Youth I threw a punch and Youth K fought back. They
were punching and kicking each other and pulled each other’s
hair. A couple of supervisors came in and restrained Youth I.
Youth P was not sure who the staff or supervisors were. Youth P
never saw staff put anything over or in Youth I's mouth. The staff
had a mesh bag that could go over their head but she never saw it
used. Another peer said it was a spit bag. Youth P saw other
restraints with Youth I. Youth P could not always see around the
staff. Youth I was on her back with staff leaning over her on each
of her sides.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
Staff 2 stated she is a first shift youth care worker. She has
worked at the facility since December of 2021. She reported she
was involved in a few restraints with Youth B. All of the restraints
with Youth B were similar. Youth B would be tearing up the unit
then she would be put in a restraint when she started to become
aggressive with staff. She would first be put in a standing hold, but
she would fight so she would be transitioned to a team restraint.
The standing hold would be with 2 staff and a supervisor
watching. The team restraint would be three people with 2 staff on
arms and one on legs. Staff 2 was unsure if Youth B ever spit or if
anything was ever used to deter spitting. She stated nothing was
ever placed in Youth B's mouth. Youth B would not fight when in
the team restraint because she was more secure.
Staff 2 reported Youth O was a spitter and she did spit on Staff 2.
All she could do about it was to move out of the way when Youth
O would spit. They did not have spit guards so there was nothing
that could be done. They were never told or were allowed to use
anything but a spit shield to block spitting. They never had spit
11

shields on hand. She would just back up or turn her head away.
Other staff did the same thing. No shirts or socks were ever used
to block spitting and nothing placed in the mouth.
Staff 2 said she was never involved in a restraint of Youth I.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
She stated if the youth spit it is only when they are in a restraint.
When doing a restraint there are 2 people on the arms and one on
the legs. Staff 5 said they did have spit guards, but the staff did
not carry them on them. They no longer order the spit guards. She
did not know why. They were not advised to use anything else. All
they could do was redirect the youth and position themselves, so
they didn’t get spit on. They were never told they could place
items over or in the mouth. She never saw a staff place a sock in
a youth’s mouth and she never observed a staff placing a shirt
over a youths face or mouth. She reported nothing was used to
block spit.
Staff 9 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
Staff 9 said when youth spit during a restraint staff would use
paper or pull the youths shirt up away from the youth’s face to
block the spit until they could get a spit mask. He could not recall
a specific incident in which this occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
She stated she recalled being in 1 or 2 restraints with Youth B.
She did not recall the other staff that were involved. She said she
was not involved in any restraints in which youth were spitting or
biting. Youth O would spit while not in a restraint but Staff 1 said
there was nothing they could do about it. All they could do was
walk away. They did not have spit guards. They never put
anything in the youth’s mouth or over the youth’s face.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
She reported she was involved in multiple restraints with Youth B.
One time they had 5 restraints in one day for Youth B. She stated
the restraints were both supine holds and standing holds. The
staff that were involved that day were Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4, Staff
5, Staff 8, Staff 17 and Staff 20. They would switch out with each
other throughout the restraints. Staff 3 did not want to be spit on
as it makes her vomit. Youth B knew Staff 3 did not like spit so
she would not spit on her. She did not need a spit guard. Another
time Youth B tried to spit and they pulled her shirt up over her
mouth. Staff 3 was in the room at the time but was not helping
with the hold. This was the same day as the other restraints she
12

mentioned. Other youth were on the unit during the restraints that
took place there. Staff 3 thought Youth F, Youth H, Youth L, and
Youth C were all present. Staff 3 reported no one put anything in
Youth B's mouth. They just pulled her shirt up to her lips. They did
not have a spit guard, so they used the collar of Youth B's shirt.
She never saw anyone put anything in Youth B's mouth. Staff 3
said she does not usually encounter spit, so no one knew where
the spit guards were. She has never even seen one. Youth B was
the only youth she ever saw spit. She heard of others but was not
present.
Staff 3 stated she was not involved in any restraints with Youth I.
Staff 19 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/21/23.
Staff 19 said she was present for a restraint with Youth I on
Valentines Day. The other staff involved were Staff 4, Staff 11,
and a lady that got laid off whose name she could not recall. Staff
19 and this lady were the staff working the unit. Staff 4 and Staff
11 were supervisors that were on that day. The only time Youth I
was spitting was when she was trying to spit on Youth K. The
youth had previously been told spitting was not an assault. Youth I
did not spit on staff. No shirt was ever placed over Youth I's mouth
when Staff 19 was there.
Staff 19 said she never participated in a restraint with Youth B and
she never saw any other youth spit.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face by the DHHS Worker on
7/7/23. This consultant participated by phone. Staff 6 said he was
not at the facility for very long as he had just returned from having
a torn ACL. Staff 6 said he did not recall Youth I. He said he was a
supervisor while at the facility. He stated the supervisor’s role was
to monitor things; however, he doesn’t recall anything specifically.
He stated he was so new there that he didn’t recall names. Staff 6
was asked about being present for or involved in any restraints
when youth were spitting. He stated he recalls hearing people
over the walkie talkie asking for a spit mask to be brought but
doesn’t recall being physically present. Staff 6 stated the spit
guards were kept in a back pocket or the med room. He stated
they were to use these for spitting, but sometimes they weren’t
available so they would just have to deal with it. Staff 6 denied
being present for or involved in any times when a shirt or any
other item was used to block spitting. Staff 6 denied being
involved in any restraints of Youth B.
13

Staff 8 was interviewed by three-way phone call on 7/27/23.
He reported he was at the facility for about a year as the trainer,
but he did many other things as well. He does recall being present
for restraints with Youth B. He was probably there for about three
or four of her restraints. He knows of at least one of those
restraints involved both Staff 1 and Staff 2. He could remember
the day but could not remember the sequence of events. He
knows she was restrained but was unsure how many times and
who was all involved. Youth B was spitting during this incident.
Staff 8 said when youth would spit they would either get a spit
guard or hold something in front of the staff's face. Youth B
regularly spit in restraints and on this day they used her shirt to
block the spit. He could not recall the staff that did this. He stated
the shirt was about 6-8 inches away from Youth B's face and not
restricting her breathing. He reported Youth B had double layers
on so they pulled her top shirt up to block the spit, but the shirt
was never over her mouth. He never saw any staff put anything in
or on Youth B's mouth. The spit guards could be gotten by a
supervisor. They were kept in the supervisor’s office or the
program managers office. Their restraint training Therapeutic
